alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Converse County through 545 PM MDT... At 457 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles southeast of Pine Tree Junction to 12 miles north of Rolling Hills. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Converse County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
